TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Coarse-loamy, mixed, superactive Typic Haplocryepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:   Sambrito loam - forest (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
01--2 to 1 inches; undecomposed organic material principally needles, bark, twigs, and the fleshy remains of grasses.
02--1 inch to 0; partially decomposed organic material like that of the horizon above.
A1--0 to 4 inches; light brownish gray (10YR 6/2) loam, grayish brown (10YR 5/2) moist; moderate fine granular and crumb structure; soft, very friable, nonplastic, nonsticky; strongly acid; clear smooth boundary.  (3 to 8 inches thick)
B2--4 to 20 inches; pale brown (10YR 6/3) gravelly coarse sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, nonplastic, nonsticky; 20 percent gravel; medium acid; gradual wavy boundary.  (7 to 23 inches thick)
C--20 to 60 inches; light gray (10YR 7/2) gravelly coarse sandy loam, grayish brown (10YR 5/2) moist; massive; slightly hard, very friable, nonplastic, nonsticky; 30 percent gravel; medium acid; gradual wavy boundary.  (28 to 50 inches thick)
IIC--60 inches; shale.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Archuleta County, Colorado; NW 1/4 Sec. 5, T. 36 N., R.  2 E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The control section is normally gravelly coarse sandy loam, but clay ranges from 2 to 18 percent.  Rock fragments range from 0 to 35 percent by volume in the major part of the control section and these are mainly pebbles and cobbles.
The A horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 5 through 7 dry, 3 through 6 moist, and chroma of 1 through 4.  It is strongly or medium acid.
The B2 horizon has hue of 10YR through 5YR, value of 5 through 7 dry, 4 through 6 moist, and chroma of 1 through 4.  It is medium acid or slightly acid.
The C horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR.  It is medium acid or slightly acid.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Azwell, Bobtail, Hanks, Jenkins, Jughandle, Lake Janee, Liggett, Ryorp, and Ualters series.  Azwell, Bobtail, Jenkins, Jughandle, and Ryorp soils have a lithic contact above depth of 40 inches.  Hanks soils have sandy-skeletal substratums above depth of 40 inches and are in areas of winter rainfall.  Lake Janee soils are medium or strongly acid, contain a high proportion of medium and coarse angular sand, and have a winter rainfall pattern.  Liggett soils are strongly or very strongly acid, have B2 horizons in which some clay is accumulating as lamellae, and have a winter rainfall pattern.  Walters soils developed in stratified alluvium that is more silty in the upper control section, have continuous horizons of visible carbonate accumulation, and have a continuous A2 horizon.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Sambrito soils are on moderately to steeply sloping ridges, mountain sides, and valley side slopes.  Slopes typically range from about 4 to 80 percent.  Elevation is about 9,400 feet.  The soils formed in thick acid gravelly moderately coarse textured materials derived mainly from sedimentary rocks.  At the type location the mean annual precipitation is 35 to 40 inches.  Mean annual temperature is 38 degrees F., mean summer temperature is 54 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Castelleia soils.  Castelleia soils have an argillic horizon and a fine-loamy control section.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; medium to rapid runoff; moderately rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used for timber production, summer wildlife habitat, and some summer cattle range.  Native vegetation is mainly spruce and fir with an understory of bushes and sedges.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  High mountain area of southwestern Colorado.  The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Archuleta County (Piedra Area), Colorado, 1974.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  OSED scanned by NSSQA and cleaned up by Colorado.  Last revised by state on 5/74.
